alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 26 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Mainly along and north of the Connecticut and Rhode Island boarders; this watch includes the cities of Springfield, Worcester, and Boston. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong thunderstorms Thursday will be capable of producing heavy rainfall, combined with already saturated soil promotes a flash flood threat for the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
